title.en: Estonia and Estonians (on the Basis of English)

faculty.address:
Tartu linn, 
Tartu linn, Tartumaa 
EST

name.en: Department of Languages of the Baltic Region

structural_unit_name.en: Department of Languages of the Baltic Region

description.en: The course consists of lectures and seminars that are dealing with Estonia and Estonians. The courses and seminars offer several possibilities to compare Estonia and other countries. During the course, students will discover Estonia and share their personal experiences of Estonia.
description.et: Kursus koosneb loengutest ja seminaridest, mille jooksul arutletakse Eesti maa, looduse, ajaloo, kultuuri, elanike ja traditsioonide üle ning võrreldakse Eestit nende riikidega, kust on pärit kursusel osalevad üliõpilased. Kursuse jooksul avastavad üliõpilased Eestit ja jagavad teistega Eestis kogetut.

objectives.en: The aim of the course is to introduce Estonia (state, nature, history, people and culture) to the foreign students of Tartu University. The course participations will discover similarities and differences of Estonia and their homelands and discuss their personal experiences in Estonia.
objectives.et: Kursuse eesmärk on tutvustada välisüliõpilastele Eesti maad, loodust, ajalugu, rahvast ja kultuuri. Kursusel osalejad leiavad Eesti ja oma kodumaa sarnaseid ja erinevaid jooni ning väljendavad oma arvamust Eestis kogetu kohta.

learning_outcomes.en: During the semester the exchange student acquires preliminary knowledge of Estonia, Estonians and Estonian culture, by listening lectures, attending seminars and completing different written and oral tasks.
learning_outcomes.et: Semestri jooksul omandab välisüliõpilane loenguid kuulates, seminaridel osaledes ja ülesandeid täites algteadmised Eestist, eestlastest, Eesti kultuurist.

notes.et: It is very important that in the class there would only be students who feel well. If one is feeling sick, it is not allowed to come to the class. Then the student must do all the class work at home and consult with the teacher how to keep up with the group.

independent_work.et:
1) Present one Estonian writer, poet, musician, band, composer, artist, film director, actor (a minimum of 500 words text length). 
2) Write an essay about her/his subjective key words of Estonia (text: minimum 1000 words. 5 keywords, a minimum of 200 words per one keyword). 
3) Create a smart quiz question and 4 variants of answers (at least 1 correct answer included) for the "Quiz of Estonia". 
4) Present her/his Estonian map "My Estonia. My Estonian Map".

grade_preconditions.et:
In order to pass the course, a student has to:
1) Present one Estonian writer, poet, musician, band, composer, artist, film director, actor (a minimum of 500 words text length). 
2) Write an essay about her/his subjective key words of Estonia (text: minimum 1000 words. 5 keywords, a minimum of 200 words per one keyword). 
3) Create a smart quiz question and 4 variants of answers (at least 1 correct answer included) for the "Quiz of Estonia". 
4) Present her/his Estonian map "My Estonia. My Estonian Map".

grade_evaluation.et:
1) Estonian Culture Person essay and presentation: 30% 
2) The Five Estonian Key Words essay and participating in the seminar 30% 
3) The Estonian Quiz question: 10% 
4) Creating and presenting My Estonian Map: 20% 
5) participation in class work and doing homework: 10%

Grading
Grade A: 90%>100%
Grade B: 80%>89%
Grade C: 70%>79%
Grade D: 60%>69%
Grade E: 50%>59%
Grade F: 0%>49%

debt_elimination.et: In agreement with the teacher, in official hours, but not later than 16.12.2022.

assessment_scale.et: Eristav (A, B, C, D, E, F, mi)
assessment_scale.en: differentiated (A, B, C, D, E, F, not present)

name.en: Department of Languages of the Baltic Region

audience.et: 10 places are reserved to SOMU students
